title: Development of Hollow-Cone Schlieren Electron Microscopy for Observation of Electromagnetic Fields
content: Schlieren electron microscopy for observing electromagnetic fields was developed as an extended microscopy technique for hollow-cone Foucault imaging [1-3]. In this present work, we precisely controlled the tilt angle of the irradiation electron beams to obtain the schlieren images under a special boundary condition between the brightfield and darkfield conditions of the hollow-cone Foucault imaging system. We utilized the obtained contrast and intensity changes in the schlieren images to visualize the electromagnetic fields in the space around the specimens [4].
